bibl.title: Pots, People and the Plural Community: A Case Study of the Greeks in Egypt at Sais.
bibl.note: An attempt to discover more about the Greek people who came to live and work at Sais in the western Nile Delta during the 26th dynasty (664-525 BC). - P. 165: Table 1: Finds of foreign pottery in Egyptian sites from the 7th-6th centuries.

bibl.title: with the collaboration of Gwen JENNES and Lara WEISS, Intercultural Contacts in the Ancient Mediterranean. Proceedings of the International Conference at the Netherlands-Flemish Institute in Cairo, 25th to 29th October 2008

bibl.seg: WILSON Penelope, Pots, People and the Plural Community: A Case Study of the Greeks in Egypt at Sais.

Kim DUISTERMAAT and Ilona REGULSKI (Edd.), with the collaboration of Gwen JENNES and Lara WEISS, Intercultural Contacts in the Ancient Mediterranean. Proceedings of the International Conference at the Netherlands-Flemish Institute in Cairo, 25th to 29th October 2008 = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 202 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2011) pp. 159-170, 1 tabl., 1 pl.

An attempt to discover more about the Greek people who came to live and work at Sais in the western Nile Delta during the 26th dynasty (664-525 BC). - P. 165: Table 1: Finds of foreign pottery in Egyptian sites from the 7th-6th centuries.
